item.title: Mentioned by Enfield Weekly Press
item.description:
Brison reacts to cabinet shuffle
That's how Kings-Hants Liberal MP Scott Brison described the Conservative party's cabinet shuffle, announced July 15 by Prime Minister Stephen Harper. He announced all 39—including eight new faces, four of which were women—on his twitter account, ...

item.title: Mentioned by Nova Scotia
item.description:
NS: Maritime economic unity could benefit all, says Brison - Daily Business Buzz
Kings-Hants MP Scott Brison spoke about possible ways to revitalize the economy of the Annapolis Valley and the province during a recent chamber of commerce breakfast. – Sara Ericsson photo. Published on July 11, 2013. Published ... By Sara Ericsson, The Kings County Advertiser/Register. Member of Parliament for Kings-Hants Scott Brison says he believes there are more opportunities for greater cooperation and efficiency, especially with today's expensive taxes, new tariffs on imports, and rising energy costs.

item.title: Mentioned by Kings County Register/Advertiser
item.description:
Economic unity could benefit all: Brison
Kings-Hants MP Scott Brison spoke about possible ways to revitalize the economy of the Annapolis Valley and the province during a July 3 Chamber of Commerce breakfast. – Sara Ericsson, www.kingscountynews.ca ... The Member of Parliament for Kings-Hants was speaking at the Chamber of Commerce breakfast held in Wolfville on July 3, where he outlined an idea proposed by members of the Senate, which suggests creating economic unity within the Maritime provinces. This unity would infer an amalgamation ...

item.title: Mentioned by Huffington Post Canada
item.description:
Unemployment 'Scarring' Youth And Parents, Liberals Say
The federal government must do more to create jobs and meaningful work experience for youth who are being left out of the economic recovery, says Liberal MP Scott Brison. (CP). The federal government must do more to create jobs and meaningful work ...

item.title: Mentioned by TheChronicleHerald.ca
item.description:
Brison wants to bridge arts, trades
OTTAWA — Students should be able to work toward a bachelor of arts degree at the same time they study for a skilled trade, says Kings-Hants MP Scott Brison. Closer co-operation between universities and community colleges is one of Brison's proposals to ...
